intro: Satureja pallida, commonly known as pale savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are fragrant, containing volatile oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja pallida is often found in rocky or dry soils, thriving in full sun.
